title: Helal Hafiz first death anniv today
body: The first anniversary of death of poet and journalist Helal Hafiz will be observed today. Born in Netrakona on October 7, 1948, Helal Hafiz’s debut collection of poems titled Je Jale Agun Jwale was published in 1986, and received acclaim. His ‘Nishiddha Sampadakiya’, written in 1969, is considered as one of the most cited poems. The line from the poem — ‘It is the best time for one to go to war who is in the youth’ — was widely used in posters, graffiti works, slogans inspiring youths to get prepared for the War of Independence and movements against autocratic regimes and the military regime in 80s. His second collection of poems titled Kabita Ekattar was published after 26 years in 2012. Helal Hafiz also worked as a journalist for many years in different newspapers, including Purbadesh, Desh and Jugantar. He received different awards, including Jashore Sahitya Puraskar in 1986 and Bangla Academy Literary Award in 2013. Helal Hafiz passed away in Dhaka on December 13, 2024.
